alert.note: Alert for West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 04 at 4:28PM PDT until November 05 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE BOLT CREEK BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Bolt Creek burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of west central Washington, including the following area, West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes. * WHEN...Until 2 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Bolt Creek burn scar is expected to continue during the period of the watch. Residents near the Bolt Creek burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. Up to 4 and half inches of rain has fallen in the area but short term rainfall rates have not exceeded rainfall thresholds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes
